chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaime Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jaime Castillo
parties.address: 308 Grove St, C/O Michelle Schmidt, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Def not to possess any alcohol.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RG & PG unless requested by victims through agent. Def not to be at or around any bars or liquor stores or any establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

IID to be installed if requested by agent. Sobrietor or GPS to be installed/used at agent discretion.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber.   Transfer of jail authorized to Dodge Co.
